title: Data Engineer
summary: I began my career at Bank of America as a data engineer, starting on the graduate scheme. While largely focussed on creating and maintaining reports for enterprise wide server vulnerabilities, the scope of my work has also expanded to designing and implementing a number of automated processes. All my work is planned, developed, tested and deployed following DevOps practices which has given me excellent proficency in a wide range of tools and processes.

achievements.description: Created from the ground up, a collection of data pipelines to pull data from various sources then load and manipulate it ready for consumption in dashboards. This included logging and syncing tools to keep track of progress and ensure that the data was duplicated across databases as required.

Created and maintain a large number of dashboards using Tableau, reporting on enterprise wide server vulnerabilities. I have learnt the ins and outs of how Tableau works and how it can be used to effectively convey a story through the visualisation of data.

Lead developer on full-stack web framework used for automation tools. Build in Django, utilising its built-in backend features and a custom front-end using JavaScript and TailwindCSS. Along with developing the application, I also planned and executed the deployment within the Bank's network giving me a great place exercise the use of Linux as well as setting up SSL and Apache in the real world.

title: Customer Assitant & Shift Leader
summary: Part-time role during my time at university. I was allowed to train to be a shift leader for when schedules required which gave me the opportunity to practice leadership and demonstates how I always want to keep learning no matter the position I am in.
